entry.title: Physical vs Logical resources
entry.summary:
Logical ID The logical ID must be alphanumeric (A-Za-z0-9) and unique within the template. Use the logical name to reference the resource in other parts of the template.

Physical ID A physical ID, which is the actual assigned name for that resource, such as an EC2 instance ID or an â€¦
entry.content:
Logical ID The logical ID must be alphanumeric (A-Za-z0-9) and unique within the template. Use the logical name to reference the resource in other parts of the template.

Physical ID A physical ID, which is the actual assigned name for that resource, such as an EC2 instance ID or an S3 bucket name. Use the physical IDs to identify resources outside of AWS CloudFormation templates, but only after the resources have been created. Eg EC2 in the console

entry.title: TIL Updating ZSH
entry.content: To update Oh-My-ZSH, all I need to run is `omz update`. Didn't even realise there was an omz command!

entry.title: TIL - AWS Lambda Environment Vars
entry.content: In AWS Lambda, if you use ENVIRONMENT VARS they are tied to the lambda version, so a new deploy is required to update that config change.

entry.title: TIL - AWS Summit - ECR
entry.content: ECR supports vulnerability scanning of pushed up repo images.

entry.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Eventbridge
entry.content: Eventbridge can translate a lot of useful internal Amazon events into a call to say a Lamdba, so you can drive custom behaviour from those events. For example: high vulnerabilities in your pushed ECR image could trigger lambda to fire off an alert(or delete the image).

entry.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Fargate Autoscaling
entry.content: Fargate supports autoscaling options that include `FARGATE` or `FARGATESPOT` for spot pricing.

entry.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Latency
entry.content: P99 and P95 latency refer to the percentage of requests should be faster than given latency.

entry.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Spot Instances
entry.content: Currently, ~5% of spot instances are getting taken out, but their pricing is 1/3 of an On-Demand instance.

entry.title: TIL - Bash Shift
entry.content:
In `bash`, use `shift` to reassign positional arguments.

For example:

```bash $1 $2 $3 ```

Would become

```bash $1 matches old $2 $2 matches old $3 ```

entry.title: TIL - Git Rebase
entry.content: In git, during rebase, ours and theirs are reversed. `theirs` is actually the current branch in the case of rebase.

entry.title: TIL - How to match python regex postgis
entry.content: Use `(.*)` for matching groups in Python regexes.
